required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multicenter Follow Up Study Of Subjects Who Participated In An Original Protocol Of Exemestane Vs. Megestrol Acetate In Postmenopausal Women With Metastatic Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Follow-up of the Study 971-ONC-0028-080: Exemestane Versus Megestrol Acetate In Postmenopausal Patients With Metastatic Breast Cancer, Failing Anti-Estrogens: An Open-Label, Randomized, Parallel-Group, Phase III Comparative Study

brief_summary.textblock: Long term efficacy of exemestane as compared to megestrol acetate in the treatment of women with natural or induced postmenopausal status with advanced breast cancer whose disease has progressed following anti-estrogens or anti-estrogens plus chemotherapy and who had participated on an original study of exemestane vs megestrol : study 971-ONC-0028-080.

primary_outcome.description: Overall survival in months measured from date of starting treatment in core study to date of death for any reason.

secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving an objective response (OR) defined as complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) out of the total number of participants randomized in each treatment group

Duration of objective response (complete response [CR] or partial response [PR]) calculated from date objective response was first documented to date of progressive disease. For subjects proceeding from PR to CR, the onset of PR was taken as the onset of objective response.

TTP = time between first day of study treatment and date of documented disease progression, or date of tumor-related death in the absence of previously documented progressive disease (PD). PD defined as a 25% or greater increase in size of 1 or more lesions compared to smallest previous assessment, or appearance of new lesion, or unequivocal worsening of bone lesions, or progression of nonevaluable lesions.

TTF = time between first day of study treatment and date of diagnosis of progression, withdrawal from study treatment for any reason, administration of other antitumor treatment, or death from any cause, whichever was the earliest event.

intervention.description: Megestrol Acetate 160 mg oral tablets Qd

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Previous participation in study 971-ONC-0028-080.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who had not previously participated in study 971-ONC-0028-080.

facility.name: Cancer Institute and Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences
Ba Yi Hospital, Cancer Center of CPLA
The 1st Affiliated Hospital, Xi'an Jiao Tong University

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Follow-up study for participants in core study who completed 26 weeks of treatment, progressed while on therapy, or dropped out for any reason. Those who benefitted from core study treatment continued according to original randomization. Those who dropped out of core study received therapy appropriate for disease and were followed for survival.

group.title: Exemestane
group.description: Exemestane 25 milligram (mg) oral tablet taken once daily

group.title: Megestrol Acetate
group.description: Megestrol acetate 160 mg tablet taken once daily

analysis.groups_desc: Overall survival compared using the hazard ratio; hazard ratio <1.0 is in favor of exemestane.

outcome.title: Objective Response Rate (ORR)
outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving an objective response (OR) defined as complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) out of the total number of participants randomized in each treatment group

outcome.title: Duration of Response (DR)
outcome.description: Duration of objective response (complete response [CR] or partial response [PR]) calculated from date objective response was first documented to date of progressive disease. For subjects proceeding from PR to CR, the onset of PR was taken as the onset of objective response.

measurement_list.measurement: The upper limit of the 95% confidence interval for the megestrol acetate treatment group was inestimable and is shown as N/A.because not enough participants progressed from objective response to progressive disease during the study period.

outcome.title: Time to Tumor Progression (TTP)
outcome.description: TTP = time between first day of study treatment and date of documented disease progression, or date of tumor-related death in the absence of previously documented progressive disease (PD). PD defined as a 25% or greater increase in size of 1 or more lesions compared to smallest previous assessment, or appearance of new lesion, or unequivocal worsening of bone lesions, or progression of nonevaluable lesions.

outcome.description: TTF = time between first day of study treatment and date of diagnosis of progression, withdrawal from study treatment for any reason, administration of other antitumor treatment, or death from any cause, whichever was the earliest event.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Exemestane
group.description: Exemestane 25 milligram (mg) oral tablet taken once daily

group.title: Megestrol Acetate
group.description: Megestrol acetate 160 mg tablet taken once daily

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: At the time of study completion in 2007, via protocol amendment participants still on treatment were allowed to continue treatment, being monitored for Serious Adverse Events (SAE) only. The final participant discontinued in 2009.
